details.concept: Single-layer design: tokens defined once in tokens.scss, used directly in component SCSS
details.no_abstraction: No component-specific CSS variables (e.g., --button-bg). Components use design tokens directly (e.g., var(--background-4))
details.single_file_per_component: Each component has one .scss file containing reset, base styles, and style variants using @include style(n)
details.style_variants: Three global style variants via nuke-style='1/2/3' attribute - use @include style(1/2/3) mixin

base_values.--unit: 6px (base size - change to scale entire UI)

details.core_principle: Two variables control everything: --unit (base size) and --ratio (growth rate)

build_scripts.build: npm run build - Compiles SCSS to CSS and bundles TypeScript

source_structure.core/core.scss: SCSS entry point (imports tokens + all components)

details.customize_tokens: Override CSS variables in your own stylesheet after importing core.css
details.style_variants: Add nuke-style='1', '2', or '3' attribute to elements for different visual styles

items.title: Frontend App
items.description: Svelte 5 documentation app in frontend/ folder. Two pages: Welcome (landing) and Components (showcase). Uses Nav.svelte for navigation, imports lib web components (<nuke-icon>, <nuke-tabs>, etc). Serves as dogfooding environment to test lib components.

items.title: Style Inheritance
items.description: nuke-style attribute cascades from parent to children. Set once on a container, all styled elements inside inherit it. The cascade is a feature, not a bug. Element-specific modifiers like [icon] stay flat boolean attributes since they shouldn't cascade.

items.title: Cascading Styles DX
items.description: Unlike other design systems that require classes on every element, nuke-style cascades from parent to children. Set once on a container, all buttons/inputs/selects inside inherit. Verbose CSS is the cost of cleaner HTML for users.

items.title: nuke-style Selector Pattern
items.description: The CSS pattern ':is(body, *)[nuke-style="1"] :is(button, ...)' enables full cascade. The ':is(body, *)' ensures body-level works - set nuke-style on <body> and ALL elements inherit globally. Override locally by setting nuke-style on any container. Any CSS refactoring (nesting, SCSS) must preserve this pattern.

items.title: Style Boundaries
items.description: Any element with nuke-style becomes a 'style boundary'. All children inherit until a new boundary overrides. Works on div, nav, section, form, body - any element. Enables scoped styling without classes on every child.

items.title: SCSS Architecture
items.description: Components use SCSS with shared mixins from _mixins.scss. Element selector variables ($btn, $input, $select, etc.) and style() mixin enable DRY code. The style($n) mixin expands to the full cascade pattern: ':is(body, *)[nuke-style="n"] &, &[nuke-style="n"]'. Files: tokens.scss (design tokens), _mixins.scss (shared mixins), core.scss (entry point), components/*.scss.
